alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for credit, debit and charge cards
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers covering the cost of credit, debit and charge card payments
title: Expenses and benefits: credit, debit and charge cards

table.body:
As an employer covering the cost of credit, debit or charge card payments made by your employees, you have certain National Insurance and reporting obligations.

##What's included

What you have to pay and how you report this depends on how the card is used and what the employee purchases with it.

^[Different rules apply](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim16100.htm "Exclusions from the scope of the non-cash voucher and credit token legislation"){:rel="external"}  when buying certain items with a card, eg fuel for a company car, parking spaces or incidental overnight expenses.^

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: Overview

table.body:
You don’t have to report or pay anything to HMRC if all the following apply:

- you've authorised your employee to make the purchase 
- your employee makes it clear during the purchase that they're acting on behalf of your business
- your employee isn't making [a purchase where different rules apply](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim16100.htm "Exclusions from the scope of the non-cash voucher and credit token legislation"){:rel="external"} (eg fuel for a company car, parking spaces or incidental overnight expenses)

*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: What's exempt

table.body:
If card charges aren't [exempt](/expenses-and-benefits-credit-debit-and-charge-cards/whats-exempt "exempt"), you must report them to HMRC and may have to deduct and pay National Insurance on them.

This depends on how the credit or debit card is used, whether it's clearly used on the employer's behalf and what the employee purchases with it.

^'Used on the employer's behalf' means that the employee makes it clear to the supplier that they are making the purchase for your business.^

##The card is used on the employer's behalf but without permission

|Who uses the card | What to do | What to deduct or pay |
| - | - |
| Employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year| Report on form P9D, section B | Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll |
| Employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year| Report on form P11D, section C | Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll |
| Directors | Report on form P11D, section C | Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll |

##The card is used for business purchases but not clearly on behalf of the employer

|Who uses the card | What to do | What to deduct or pay |
| - | - |
| Employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year| Report on form P9D, section B | Nothing |
| Employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year| Report on form P11D, section C | Nothing |
| Directors | Report on form P11D, section C | Nothing |

##The card is used for private purchases but not clearly on behalf of the employer

|Who uses the card | What to do | What to deduct or pay |
| - | - |
| Employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of less than £8,500 a year| Report on form P9D, section B | Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll |
| Employees earning [at a rate](/employer-reporting-introduction-to-expenses-and-benefits/calculate-earnings-at-a-rate "at a rate") of £8,500 or more a year| Report on form P11D, section C | Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll |
| Directors | Report on form P11D, section C | Deduct and pay Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through payroll |


*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
